CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 2, 1954, pg. 6, reads: "Perpetuating Gaines' Party - The death of George Gaines, East End mortician and Grand Master of Pennsylvania Masons earlier this year, did not rob the youngsters of the annual Christmas party given at the Gaines' Funeral Home on Auburn Street.  In this picture, his widow, Mrs. Julia Gaines, shown in front of the Christmas tree, in the top center, takes charge of the handing out of toys and candy to the youngsters just as her late husband did for many years.  - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of children, including two girls wearing head scarves on right, and Julia Gaines wearing dark v-neck top and standing in center of back row, gathered for annual Christmas party at Gaines Funeral Home, another version
